articles.title: At SoftBank’s Jewel in India: ‘Toxic’ Culture and Troubling Incidents
articles.description: Backed by SoftBank, Oyo aims to be the world’s biggest hotel chain. But its growth was fueled by questionable practices, employees said.
articles.content: Oyo is trying to expand globally and now offers more than 1.2 million rooms in 80 countries, including the United States. It employs more than 20,000 people and has raised more than $2.5 billion in funding. Mr. Agarwal has become a business star, hobnobbing w… [+1181 chars]

articles.title: Compassion, Not Patriarchy, at A.A. Meetings
articles.description: Three readers rebut an Op-Ed article that was critical of A.A. “Walking into my first A.A. meeting was the single bravest thing I have ever done,” one writes.
articles.content:
Through self-knowledge and community support, I am happy and sober today. And I will always be appreciative of the kind, loving, selfless volunteers of Alcoholics Anonymous who helped me get that way.
Stephen D.Brooklyn

articles.title: The Best of Japanese Dining and Design, Under One Parisian Roof
articles.description: Encompassing a teahouse, a confectionery stand and more, Ogata Paris pays homage to its setting while offering a true taste of Japan.
articles.content: For both its size (over 8,600 square feet) and breadth, the project is the apotheosis and synthesis of everything the designer has done. Shinichiro Ogata was raised in Japans Nagasaki Prefecture, on the west coast of the volcanic island of Kyushu, sometime af… [+1573 chars]

articles.description: An electrifying revival, starring a heartbreaking Wendell Pierce, reimagines Willy Loman as a black man in a white man’s world.

articles.title: Thousands Flee Fires in Australia as States Warn Crisis Will Worsen
articles.description: “It’s going to be a blast furnace,” one official said, after predictions that next few days would be the worst yet in an already catastrophic fire season.
articles.content:
An Australian Navy ship arrived on Thursday in the waters off Mallacoota, a town in Victoria, where about 4,000 people were stranded along the shore. Fires had cut off all escape routes on land, and heavy smoke ruled out helicopter rescues.

articles.title: Denying professor tenure, Harvard sparks a debate over ethnic studies
articles.description: The news spread quickly, angering Latino students and others at Harvard: One of the few professors who specialised in Latino and Caribbean studies and devoted time to mentoring them had been denied tenure.
